title: "Training School Programme"

The training school will take place over five days, beginning with structured teaching and hands on activities and allowing time towards the end of the week to discuss how to apply these good practices to the applicants own circumstances.

This page provides the programme of the training school, the topics covered and, in due course, links to the training materials.

-   Welcome - Outline of Training Programme
-   Introduction to the ADS
-   Attendee introductions
-   Collection Highlights from the ADS
-   Activity: Set personal trainee objectives.

### Tuesday 12th November - Data Management

-   Open Research and Archaeological Data
-   The FAIR and CARE data principles
-   An Introduction to Data Management

### Thursday 14th November - Dissemination and Data Reuse

-   Collections Management

-   Identifying objectives for One on One Sessions

### üßë Friday 15th November - One one one sessions with ADS Experts

Participants will be matched with an appropriate expert from the ADS to discuss their specific needs and requirements for their organisation or research project. We recommend that each participant come to the training school with a specific requirement in mind, however, we can also help to provide support during the training sessions. These sessions will take place on the last day of the training school.

## Keynote lecture

The keynote lecture by ADS Director **Professor Julian Richards** will take place on Wednesday, 13th November at 4:00 pm, followed by a social event.
